location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.41 of 1851 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commanding Indian Naval Squadron, Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Hennell's response to Porter's letter of 24 February 1851 (f 33), enclosing a letter for Sheikh Sultan ben Suggur [Sultan bin Saqr] of the Joasmee [Al Qawasim] tribe on the Trucial Coast, requesting that he provide Porter with the use of a boat and pilot for his operations on the Qatar coast. Hennell responds to Porter's query over the exact location of Fowareet [Fuwairit] and Doah [Doha], stating that the latter is the place 'belonging to Ben Sanee [bin Thani] situated on the Bay or Doah of Bidda about two or three miles of the southward of that town.'
